To make the car more environmentally friendly, designers could consider using alternative fuels or power sources. For example, they could incorporate electric batteries or solar panels into the car design.
To make the car more comfortable for long-distance drivers, designers could consider adding ergonomic features, such as adjustable seats and steering wheels, and built-in entertainment centers.
To make the car more efficient in terms of space utilization, designers could consider incorporating fold-out seats or expandable storage compartments.
To make the car more user-friendly, designers could consider incorporating intuitive interfaces and controls, such as touch screens and voice-activated controls.
To make the car more customizable, designers could consider allowing buyers to choose from a range of options, such as different colors, styles, and features, when they purchase the car.
